etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From scientific Latin Myzostomida, class name from Myzostoma + -ida

definitions: Any of various small annelid worms belonging to the class Myzostomida, which have disc-like bodies with suckers and are commensals and ectoparasites of echinoderms, especially crinoids.

notes.text: Myzostomids are placed by some authors in the class Polychaeta, as members of the family Myzostomidae.

definitions: Of, relating to, or designating a myzostomid.
